programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: The beautiful villages of the Pays de Herve We take a wander through the Pays de Herve, in the Province of Liège, from one beautiful village to the next: Olne, Soiron, Clermont-sur-Berwinne. So many delightful spots to take a break amidst the patchwork of fields, copses and hedgerows, the stone-built houses and the footpaths. Presented by: Armelle, Guy Lemaire, Jean-Philippe Watteyne.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Change of plan Bad weather curtails the expedition. The precious weather report arrives from Switzerland, much delayed. When an improvement is announced, the team can finally concentrate on preparing the final climb, that of Xuelian Feng. But people disagree on which route to take. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Creemore, Ontario
Around fifty bats have taken up residence in an old house. Louis' mission is to gently move them out.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Moi j'mange
programme.sub-title: Ce qui pousse dans mon jardin !
programme.desc:
Growing in my garden!
On the menu: Greek salad with tofu feta, melon and mint gazpacho, Korean-style grilled vegetables and chicken.
Presented by: Stéphane Bellavance. Directed by: Patrice Ouimet (season 2, Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica of Saint Severinus, Bordeaux. Designer and plastic artist, Jules Levasseur stretches, transforms and cuts materials to give them a second life. We discover the traces Pablo Picasso left of his work in Paris. An immersion in the world of the mosaic artist Béatrice Serre. Presented by: Katherina Marx

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.sub-title: Joran Briand et Arnaud Berthereau/Le papier
programme.desc: From western France to Paris, the designers Joran Briand and Arnaud Berthereau bring their very French touch to the world of design. Paper isn't just for writing on, in the hands of Sandrine Beaudun it's transformed into delicate sculptures, as light as air. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Tourism by train A veritable tribute to the train! Armelle discovers the various deals offered by the SNCB for tourists, visits one of the world's most beautiful stations and, in the company of a true railway enthusiast, explores line 43 Liège-Marche-en-Famenne, along a route that combines travelling by train, bike and foot. Presented by: Armelle.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc: Setting their sights high The team divides into two rope parties according to each person's preferences. Over five days, they will climb different peaks: the north Xuelian for some and the west Xuelian for others. They embark on the most demanding climb of their lives. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto and Keswick, Ontario
A horrible smell drives a client to call in Louis... Louis will investigate and re-establish a breathable environment.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Moi j'mange
programme.desc:
Honey
On the menu: cheese and spiced honey croquettes, lemon cake with honey, and honey and prawn fried rice.
Presented by: Stéphane Bellavance. Directed by: Patrice Ouimet (season 2, Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Holy Trinity Orthodox Cathedral. The experimental designer Marlène Huissoud weaves her artistic web around a world where man and insect cohabit. A Parisian journey in the footsteps of the film-maker Michel Audiard. Caroline Cochet and the endless possibilities offered by the Japanese shibori dyeing technique. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: An encounter with the Michelin-starred chef Guy Savoy, in the midst of his restaurant at the Monnaie de Paris. The feather: light, fragile, almost ethereal... yet it dutifully obeys the every whim of Maxime Leroy, featherworker, to create works that are as avant-garde as they are sculptural. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Tourism by train A veritable tribute to the train! Armelle discovers the various deals offered by the SNCB for tourists, visits one of the world's most beautiful stations and, in the company of a true railway enthusiast, explores line 43 Liège-Marche-en-Famenne, along a route that combines travelling by train, bike and foot. Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 3
We set off to meet the owners of sumptuous and remarkable homes in Meilen (canton of Zurich), Graubünden and Saint-Gall. A fascinating immersion in their daily lives and their past...
Presented by: Viola Tami. Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Les saisons de Pique-assiette
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Chroniques d'en haut
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: A visit behind the scenes of the Château de Versailles Royal Opera House, by the architect Ange-Jacques Gabriel. A new type of gallery-owner, Amélie du Chalard reinvents the profession, bringing art into the home, both hers and yours. Paris in the footsteps of General de Gaulle. Focus on French bagpipes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.sub-title: Joran Briand et Arnaud Berthereau/Le papier

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
Royan Atlantique
We set our heading for the Royan Atlantique where Sébastien fishes by eye and ear. Brice talks about his passion for salt. Focus on the white storks and other birds nesting in the region. All about the oyster huts of La Tremblade.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Does Chalon-sur-Saône have a good image? Does the place of birth of Nicéphore Niepce, who invented photography, have a good image? To find out, Guillaume sets off to discover this small mediaeval town, the birthplace of photography. Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Basilica of Saint Severinus, Bordeaux. Designer and plastic artist, Jules Levasseur stretches, transforms and cuts materials to give them a second life. We discover the traces Pablo Picasso left of his work in Paris. An immersion in the world of the mosaic artist Béatrice Serre. Presented by: Katherina Marx

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: In Paris we head off to visit to the Pantheon. Prepare to enter those areas where no-one else goes! Then an encounter with Philippe Perissé, a fashion designer inspired by the world of heroines. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les ambassadeurs
programme.desc: Tourism by train A veritable tribute to the train! Armelle discovers the various deals offered by the SNCB for tourists, visits one of the world's most beautiful stations and, in the company of a true railway enthusiast, explores line 43 Liège-Marche-en-Famenne, along a route that combines travelling by train, bike and foot. programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 9:

Place Vendôme, spotlight on the jeweller Lorenz Bäumer. All there is to know about the kiss. Chausse Mouton has turned the traditional French carpet slipper into a modern accessory, whilst continuing to respect traditional French techniques. How to wear a sweater dress? Portrait of Roger Vincent, pipe carver in Saint-Claude.

Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Succulent !
programme.desc:
Rum baba
We rediscover this great classic desert: the rum baba. And even when prepared completely by the book, a little touch of fantasy is always possible, such as today's recipe, flavoured with rhubarb wine.
Presented by: Marie Montuir

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life on a floating island We head to Freedom Cove, a floating island built thirty years ago by Catherine and Wayne, a couple of artists. Impressed by the audacity of the project, Julien explores the challenges of life on the water, totally independent in terms of energy and food. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #chicenVF
programme.desc: The plastic artist Éva Jospin takes us on an expedition through the heart of her cardboard forests and other contemporary works. The Middle Ages seem so very far away? Focus on a technique inherited from the period: illumination. Commentary: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Muffin recipes
Ricardo suggests a selection of muffin recipes for a filling snack easy to eat on the go: apricot muffins, sweetcorn muffins and pear, date and cream cheese muffins.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Monte-Carlo Riviera
programme.desc:
The story of Saint Devota, patron saint of Monaco, and the mystery that surrounds her: legend or reality? One of Monaco's neighbouring towns that was part of the Principality for several centuries: we explore Roquebrune-Cap Martin. A visit to a surprising cave dwelling in the company of its architect.
Presented by: Cyril Viguier.
